text.content: Buttons trigger actions. Available variants: primary, secondary, danger, ghost, warning, success, info.
Labels display text at various sizes: xs, sm, md (default), lg, xl.
Icons render named vector icons from the gpui-component icon set.
Checkboxes toggle boolean state. Support labels and disabled state.
Text inputs for user data entry. Support placeholder text and disabled state.
Textarea is a multi-line text input. Supports configurable rows, placeholder text, auto-grow, and default values.

textarea.placeholder: Start typing and the textarea will grow...

textarea.default-value: This textarea has a default value. It supports multiple lines of text.

text.content: Code Editor provides syntax-highlighted code editing with line numbers, search, and configurable indentation.
Text Editor is a rich-text editing area with a toolbar for basic formatting: Bold, Italic, and Underline. Uses markdown-style markers.

text-editor.default-value:
# Welcome to the Text Editor
Use the toolbar above to insert **bold**, _italic_, or __underline__ markers.
This is a simple rich-text editing experience.

text.content: Select presents a list of options for the user to choose from.
Progress bars show completion percentage. Set value (0-100) and optional max.
Notifications display status messages. Types: info, success, warning, error.
Modals display overlay dialogs. Toggle the open property to show or hide.
This is the modal content. Click the button again to close.
Text displays plain content blocks. Use for paragraphs or descriptions.
This is a simple text block. It renders plain content without any special formatting.
Text components are useful for displaying descriptions, help text, and other informational content within your application layout.
Lists render arrays of items as a vertical list with hover highlighting.
Panels are containers with padding and background. Stacks arrange children vertically or horizontally with configurable spacing.
Table displays tabular data with columns, sorting, and row selection.
Tree displays hierarchical data with expand/collapse and keyboard navigation.
Image displays an image from a source path. Falls back to alt text when no source is provided.

image.alt: Another image placeholder with alt text

text.content: Chart components for data visualization. Supports line, bar, area, pie, candlestick, column, stacked, clustered, scatter, bubble, heatmap, radar, pyramid, and funnel charts.
Accordions show collapsible content sections. Supports multiple open items and bordered styles.

text.content: Alerts display important messages. Variants: info, success, warning, error.

alert.title: Information
alert.message: This is an informational alert message.

alert.title: Warning
alert.message: Please review the changes before continuing.

alert.title: Error
alert.message: Something went wrong. Please try again.

text.content: Avatars display user initials. Provide a name to generate initials automatically.
Badges show notification counts or dot indicators on child elements.
Collapsible sections expand and collapse to reveal child content.
This content is visible by default because open = true.
This content is hidden by default and will show when expanded.
Dropdown buttons combine a button with a dropdown menu indicator.

dropdown-button.label: Save
dropdown-button.items: ["Save as Draft","Save and Publish","Save as Template"]

text.content: Spinners indicate loading state. Available sizes: xs, sm, md (default), lg.
Tags are small labels for categorization. Variants: primary, secondary, danger, success, warning, info.
Tooltips show additional information on hover.
Radio groups allow selecting one option from a set. Support vertical and horizontal layouts.
Sliders allow selecting a numeric value within a range. Supports min, max, step, and default value.
Switches toggle boolean state, similar to checkboxes but with a sliding visual style.
Toggle buttons switch between on/off states. Support labels and icons.
All components support shared styling attributes via apply_layout_styles: padding, margin, border, shadow, and rounded. These wrap any component in a styled container.
